resources.string: Check for your RSA encrypted WiMAX Keys!
Root permission is required to access the WiMAX partition. If no root access is available an error message will be displayed. \nOn a rare occasion, a WiMAX RSA key search could take up to 45 seconds.
Credits: slushpupie, birbeck, AntiSociaL, LouZiffer, shift, shinzul, toastcfh, thenuge, sdx-developers.com, #teamwin and #htc-evo!"

In order to help further development by better understanding this application\'s usage, google analytics is employed to gather anonymous usage statistics. Rest assured no personally identifiable information is ever shared and only information relating to this specific application\'s usage would be collected. Appreciate your support!

All those mentioned in the credits have been extremely helpful! 
Thanks for using my software! 

http://www.joeyconway.com
Sorry, you do not have root access. \nRoot access is required to verify WiMAX RSA key.
Sorry, you do not have Busybox installed correctly! \nFor proper Busybox installation, please search for the BusyBox app by Stericson in the market!
Sorry, this phone does not identify itself as an HTC EVO or an HTC Shift!
No WiMAX partition present at /dev/mtd/mtd0 for the EVO or /dev/block/mmcblk0p25 for the Shift
Your WiMAX certificate could not be verified. 4G must be enabled to verify (need not be connected, however)
Sorry, your WiMAX RSA key is missing!
Congratulations! Your HTC %s RSA key is present!
Congratulations! Your certificate matches your hardware!
Your certificate is present, does not match your hardware. This might be a problem.
Your certificate is present, but without 4G enabled it cannot be verified.
Checking for the WiMAX RSA Key! This can take up to 45 seconds. Please be patient!
